posts.title: Book & Activities for Winter Fun With Little Ones At Home
posts.text: We have a few suggestions for winter reads and simple art and sensory activities to keep young kids engaged at home.

posts.title: Kind Reads for Kind Kids
posts.text: Emotions can be tricky to understand at any age, and hard to explain to little ones who might be going through something for the first time. Here are a few books that celebrate kindness and help little ones to understand big feelings!

posts.title: Picture Books for Indigenous Peoples' Day
posts.text: We've rounded up some of our favorite picture books by Indigenous authors for families to share with little ones. Celebrate your identity or learn something new with these fantastic reads.

posts.title: NYPL Celebrates Early Learners
posts.text: The Library is here for families with little ones who are starting school or headed to early education centers for the first time!

posts.title: Gold Medal Picks for Early Readers
posts.text: We’ve rounded up books that explore our favorite Olympic sports, as well as a few biographies of beloved athletes who found historic success.

posts.title: Picture Books to Share on St. Patrick's Day
posts.text: In addition to highlighting beloved Irish folklore, myths, and legends, we included titles from talented Irish authors writing today.

posts.title: 5 Picture Books to Celebrate Italian-American Heritage Month
posts.text: Books you'll love to share with young kids which celebrate Italian-American culture and history.

posts.title: Early Literacy Blog: Thank You for Attending the Big Playdate!
posts.text: The Library is beyond grateful to the 684 guests who attended our first-ever Big Playdate event! See a great photo from the event, and great Big Playdate ideas you can enjoy at home with your little ones.

posts.title: Drag Queen Storytime: A Video for Children and Parents
posts.text: Drag Queen Story Hour has been partnering with the New York Public Library for over two years. DQSH offer inclusive, gender-affirming programs with storytime favorites and new LGBTQ reads for our youngest patrons, with lots of songs and glitter along the way.

posts.title: Spring into Early Literacy with the NYPL Big Playdate
posts.text: Families across New York City are invited to celebrate the power of play! We'll transform the Celeste Bartos Forum into an early learning playground on Friday, May 10. Check out the details, register for free online, and join us!

posts.title: Early Literacy Events and More: Winter at NYPL
posts.text: Meet two children's librarians with great energy, and even better ideas, for your youngsters while winter is still bearing down on New York City. See how creative play can lead to kid literacy.

posts.title: Welcome to the NYPL Early Literacy Blog!
posts.text: Enjoy this new series that highlights NYPL programs created for kids up to age 5 and their families.

posts.title: Interview: NYPL Sings! and "Are You Ready to Move?"
posts.text: Here's our latest look at how the music was created for the first album of original children's songs written and performed by NYPL staff.

posts.title: Interview: Inside NYPL Sings! and "Every Day is a New Day"
posts.text: Meet the co-writer of the NYPL Sings! track that teaches kids about everyday routines and tricky daily transitions.

posts.title: Interview: Inside NYPL Sings! and "Dealing With Feelings"
posts.text: In our continuing look inside the music album "NYPL Sings!", we speak to the co-creator of a sweet, simple song that explains emotions to kids.

posts.title: Interview: Inside NYPL Sings! and "I Read Everywhere"
posts.text: How do you work spelling into a song? Find out, in this interview with songwriter-musician - and NYPL librarian - Leah Labrecque.

posts.title: Interview: Inside NYPL Sings! and "Greetings From NYC"
posts.text: Writer-musician Joe Picciotto talks about how the NYPL Sings! team created a children's song featuring multiple languages and music styles.

posts.title: Interview: Inside NYPL Sings! and "The Library Song"
posts.text: To celebrate the release of NYPL Sings, NYPL's first album of original children's songs, we talked with two of its creators. Get a behind-the-scenes look and listen to "The Library Song"!

posts.title: Zetta Elliott Comes to KidsLIVE!
posts.text: We asked author and educator Zetta Elliott a few questions about what she likes to read.
